A sustainable system for biobanking with stringent oversight and governance needs to be set up as a global good. The Nagoya Protocol is a UN Treaty on Access to Genetic Resources and the Fair and Equitable Sharing of Benefits Arising from their Utilization.
6 It should be an urgent priority to adapt the principles of this international agreement for sharing the benefits arising from the use of resources in a fair and equitable way and for arriving at a global consensus and commitment for the sharing of specimens and virus strains for benefits, such as negotiated pricing of diagnostics for countries that contributed to the network.
